perturbation.changed_text:
4.
Advertising Sales. Programmer shall have the sole and exclusive right to sell advertising time on the HD2 Channel and retain all revenues generated therefrom. Programmer may also market the WLIB Programs as being rebroadcast on the HD2 Channel.
perturbation.explanation: This change contradicts the original clause, which prohibited Programmer from selling advertising time. Now, the Programmer has the exclusive right to sell ads, creating a direct conflict and uncertainty about which party controls advertising revenue.

perturbation.original_text:
11.1
Programmer’s Events of Default. The occurrence of any of the following will be deemed an Event
of Default by Programmer under this Agreement: (a) Programmer fails to observe or perform its obligations contained in this
Agreement in any material respect; or (b) Programmer breaches the representations and warranties made by it under this
Agreement in any material respect.
perturbation.changed_text:
11.1
Programmer’s Events of Default. The occurrence of any of the following *may* be deemed an Event
of Default by Programmer under this Agreement: (a) Programmer fails to observe or perform its obligations contained in this
Agreement in any material respect, *subject to Licensee's discretion*; or (b) Programmer breaches the representations and warranties made by it under this
Agreement *only if Licensee suffers direct financial loss* in any material respect.
perturbation.explanation: The original text states that failure to perform obligations or breach of warranties 'will be deemed' an event of default. The modified text changes this to 'may be deemed', introducing ambiguity and giving the Licensee discretion. Furthermore, it adds conditions (Licensee's discretion, direct financial loss) that were not present before, conflicting with the absolute nature of the original clause. This creates uncertainty regarding what constitutes a default.

perturbation.original_text:
21.
Force Majeure and Facilities Upgrades. The failure of either party hereto to comply with its obligations under
this Agreement due to (i) facility maintenance, repair or modification at a transmitter site or to move a transmitter site in response to
FCC authorization of an improvement to or modification of the Station’s operating parameters, or (ii) with respect to a failure to
comply with an obligation under this Agreement, acts of God, strikes or threats thereof or a force majeure event or due to causes
beyond such party’s reasonable control, will not constitute an Event of Default under Section 11 of this Agreement and neither
party will be liable to the other party therefor. Programmer and Licensee each agrees to exercise its commercially reasonable
efforts to remedy the conditions described in parts “(i)” and “(ii)” of this Section as soon as practicable.
perturbation.changed_text:
21.

The modified text states that it *will* constitute an event of default. This creates a clear conflict, leaving it unclear whether such events can trigger termination of the agreement.
